categories.name: Russian Literature: From Tolstoy to Turgenev

questions.clue: This Tolstoy novel, published in 1869, tells the story of Russian society during the Napoleonic Era.
In this 1877 novel, Tolstoy explores themes of family, adultery, and society, centered around its tragic heroine.
This Turgenev work, published in 1862, introduced the term 'nihilism' to describe the protagonist Bazarov's philosophy.
Tolstoy's novella about a landowner's existential crisis, considered a masterful exploration of mortality and the human condition.
This Turgenev novel, featuring the character Rudin, delves into the disillusionment of the intelligentsia in mid-19th-century Russia.

categories.name: Mathematical Marvels: The World of Numbers

questions.clue: This is the only even prime number.

questions.clue: For 200 points: This Russian city is known for its iconic dish of beet soup, traditionally served with sour cream.
For 400 points: Famous for its pelmeni, this Siberian city offers a taste of Russia's dumpling heritage.
For 600 points: Known for its seafood, this city on Russia's Pacific coast is famous for its Kamchatka crab.

For 1000 points: Known for its diverse culinary offerings, this city features the Tatar dish chak-chak, a sweet made with dough and honey.

categories.name: Ancient Wonders: Mysteries of the Past

questions.clue: In 2023, researchers in Russia developed a new vaccine to combat this seasonal illness more effectively.
